products.name: Samsung Galaxy J21
products.description: The Galaxy J2 is powered by an Exynos 3475 SoC including a quad-core 1.3 GHz ARM Cortex-A7 CPU, an ARM Mali-T720 GPU and 1 GB RAM. The 8 GB internal storage can be upgraded up to 256 GB via microSD card.It features a 4.7-inch Super AMOLED display.

products.name: Redmi Note 7
products.description: The Redmi Note 7(lavender) and Note 7 Pro(violet), both have a 6.3-inch full HD+ (2340x1080 pixels) display with a 19.5:9 aspect ratio. The Redmi Note 7 is powered by an 14nm Octa-Core Snapdragon 660 SoC.

products.name: Nokia 7.2
products.description: This Nokia smartphone comes with a triple-sensor rear camera featuring ZEISS Optics. Its 48 MP main sensor is ideal for capturing fine details, the 5 MP depth sensor captures true-to-life ZEISS portraits, and the 8 MP sensor has an ultra-wide 118Â° lens

products.name: Vivo V15 Pro
products.description: The Vivo V15 Pro smartphone comes with a notch free screen. It offers a 6.39-inch FHD+ Ultra Fullview Super AMOLED display with 19.5:9 aspect ratio and 91.64%Screen to body ratio. The handset is powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 675AIE with 6GB RAM and 128GB ROM which is expandable up to 256 GB.It runs on Android 9 Pie based FunTouch 9 operating system.

products.name: Samsung Galaxy Z
products.description: Samsung Galaxy Z Flip smartphone was launched on 20th February 2020. The phone comes with a 6.70-inch touchscreen primary display with a resolution of 1080x2636 pixels at a pixel density of 425 pixels per inch (ppi). It also features a 1.10-inch as its second display, with a resolution of 112x300 pixels at a pixel density of 303 pixels per inch (ppi).

products.name: Huawei  P40 Pro
products.description: The P40 series is powered by the HiSilicon Kirin 990 5G processor, meaning that all models will have 5G connectivity standard. However, only 'sub-6' 5G is available, meaning the P40 series is not compatible with ultra-fast millimeter-wave (mmWave) networks. The Kirin 990 5G is assisted by the Mali-G76 MP16 GPU.

products.name: Huawei Honor 8 Lite
products.description: It sports a 5.2-inch full HD display that makes the phone easy to use with one hand. Powering the phone is a Kirin 655 octa-core processor made by Huawei. The phone has 4GB of RAM and 64GB of internal storage. ... The 8 Lite runs Honor's latest EMUI 5.0 on top of Android 7.0 Nougat.

products.name: Huawei Mate 10e
products.description: The Huawei Mate 10, Huawei Mate 10 Pro and Huawei Mate 10 Lite are Android smartphones designed and marketed by Huawei as part of the Huawei Mate series. There is also a Mate 10 Porsche design, which has 256Gb of storage but is otherwise identical to the Mate 10 Pro. They were first released on 16 October 2017

products.name: Redmi note 8 Pro
products.description: he Redmi Note 8, Redmi Note 8T and Redmi Note 8 Pro are smartphones developed by Redmi, a sub-brand of Xiaomi Inc. They were released on 29 August 2019 in an event held in China.The Redmi Note 8 Pro is the first smartphone released with a 64 megapixel camera.The Note 8 Pro was released in Italy on 23 September 201

products.name: Honor 7x
products.description: The Honor 7X is the first phone in Honor's X series to sport an 18:9 Full View display. It sports a 5.93-inch display with FHD+ resolution. It is powered by a HiSilicon Kirin 659 SoC and has 4GB of RAM onboard. It is available in 32GB and 64GB storage variants and both are expandable up to 256GB using a microSD card.

products.name: Samsung Galaxy Note20
products.description: Samsung Galaxy Note 20 is powered by a 2.4GHz octa-core Samsung Exynos 990 processor that features 4 cores clocked at 2.4GHz and 4 cores clocked at 1.8GHz. It comes with 8GB of RAM. The Samsung Galaxy Note 20 runs Android 10 and is powered by a 4300mAh non-removable battery.
